newsitem.title: USA: BTG says will link government to cyberspace.
newsitem.headline: BTG says will link government to cyberspace.

text.p: BTG Inc said Tuesday it was selected by the U.S. General Services Administration for the $600 million CINEMA program to acquire Internet access, electronic mail and electronic commerce services for the entire federal government.
The company said it estimates potential revenue of $200 million over five years.
The company said the contract, which was also awarded to one other contractor, IBM's Advantis, has a base period of two years with an extension option for an additional three years.
The company said its subcontractors on the program include UUNET, which will provide Internet access, and Sterling Commerce Inc, which will work on e-mail and electronic commerce services.

The company said CINEMA (Electronic Commerce, INternet, and Electronic Mail Access Services) is a program of the Federal Telecommunications Service (FTS), which provides technology solutions to Federal agencies.
The company also said its Oklahoma City office has been awarded a FAA contract to install 500 servers and workstations at 120 sites around the world.
